column4: I'm having some trouble installing G++ on ubuntu 9.10 server,
state your problem
g++: Depends: gcc (>= 4:4.4.1-1ubuntu2) but it is not going to be installed
Depends: g++-4.4 (>= 4.4.1-1) but it is not going to be installed
Depends: gcc-4.4 (>= 4.4.1-1) but it is not going to be installed
don't flood the channel please, i understand.
i'll check from my servers.
Running ubuntu 9.10 server edition, with a LAMP package installed and openbox. Oh, sorry
at kimocoder: I think I may have just screwed something up, I'm just not particularly adept with aptitude/dpkg.
have you checked the package dependencies?
not sure how to.
try fix them from aptitude ..
ok
I can navigate aptitude pretty well, i've just never had to deal with dependency problems before,
i will give you a solution in 1 min
at kimocoder; thanks
I get:        Depends: g++-4.4 (>= 4.4.1-1) but it is not going to be installed
Depends: gcc-4.4 (>= 4.4.1-1) but it is not going to be installed
don't paste flood. i understand your problem.
terminal > wget ftp://ftp.gnu.org/gnu/gcc/gcc-4.4.3/gcc-4.4.3.tar.gz | tar -zxvf gcc-4.4.3.tar.gz
then you may need this..: wget ftp://ftp.gnu.org/gnu/gcc/gcc-4.4.3/gcc-g++-4.4.3.tar.gz | tar -zxvf gcc-g++-4.4.3.tar.gz | cd gcc-gc++-4.4.3 | sh ./configure | make | make install
So just build it myself, basically, without using apt?
exactly.
